file_content.text: Kolto bath patched me right up. Ready for action, my lord.
Darth Baras has made contact, I updated him. I have him and Moff Hurdenn on holo for you.
Patch them through immediately.
Let me talk to him.
Will do.
With three of the four generals taken out, Baras better be complimentary.
He should be happy.
Compliments don't seem his style. Patching him through.
I wish Baras wouldn't bother me while I'm working.
What now?
Tried telling him that, found it hard to breathe. Patching him through.
Apprentice, your progress has been conveyed to me, and I've been briefed on the search for General Faraire.
Moff Hurdenn informs me that Faraire has relocated all of the Republic's forces on Taris to protect his command center at the Republic stronghold.
We have his attention--and he's worried.
He's scared.
A frightened enemy can be the most dangerous.
Guess I know where I'm going next.
He won't be hard to find.
First you must convene with me.
They will all perish under my might.
The more, the merrier.
In good time, my apprentice. All in good time.
This assault will take all our firepower. I've summoned your crew to the base. They will all be utilized.
And I've informed Moff Hurdenn that you are commandeering the entirety of his forces.
Yes, right, they are yours to command, my lord.
I have longed to lead an army!
Time to wage war!
You will now sink your teeth into full scale war.
Nice to see you know your place, Imperial.
As it should be.
I've found the Moff to be extremely eager to accommodate.
That's very gracious of you, Hurdenn.
Thank you.
Nothing short of a full scale war will bring General Faraire down.
Rendezvous with Hurdenn, Pierce and your crew at the Imperial base. There is much planning to do. Be swift.
I'm in a medevac transport, arriving back at base. Needed to tap you.
My lord, I spent all my ammunition and I'm down to my last medpac, but Durant's battalion is down.
So is the rest of my unit. Never seen men stare death in the face and fight more bravely.
They did their job. Now the enemy is mine.
It was their duty.
You did well. Will you survive?
I hope you'll recover.
Lost a lot of blood, but I'll try to get back to base and patched up.
Your usefulness is ended.
I don't need losers.
If your wounds claim you, die knowing that you came up short.
Don't plan on dying.
General Durant and his guards have retreated inside the compound.
Proud I ushered you to the doorstep.
My lord, the enemy is regrouping. I'm down to three men, against about three hundred.
Hoped we could take out a whole battalion, but it looks like we'll come up short.
When you see him, tell Durant to--
Pierce, here. Me and a few lucky men are now garrisoned just inside General Durant's compound.
They can't use the artillery with us up their backside, but they've got enough warm bodies to kill us the old-fashioned way.
I'll check in again when we've found a defensible position--
Pierce, here! They flushed us out; we're on the move!
Lost a third of my men but we're hitting them ten-to-one. Still too many.
I'll try to rally the men, hold the enemy off as long as I can. Pierce out!
Tracked General Durant's battalion, led my black ops troopers on a recon run. Found Durant's hideout.
He's got a full battalion guarding the compound. They're establishing a perimeter of electronic defenses around the general.
Defense systems will not repel me.
A minor inconvenience.
Good to hear.
Send me the coordinates.
Tell me where.
Coordinates sent.
Do something about it.
Confront them.
Wish we could.
My black ops troopers and I were able to slip past the perimeter before they got the systems online, but we were spotted.
We're taking fire, outnumbered. Should be able to hold them off long enough for you to break through but that's it.
I will not accept failure, Lieutenant.
Be sure you do.
On my way.
Well, we're not going anywhere.
I am not pleased.
We'll do what we can.
Knock out those defense systems. We'll hold the position for you. Or worst case, our bodies will slow down their charge.
Proud to have served, my lord. Pierce out.
Pierce, here.
Ah, there you are. I see Lieutenant Pierce has already hailed you. I was hoping to do it myself.
Can I assume the lieutenant has updated you? Thanks to me, General Durant's personal battalion will not be joining him wherever he is.
Engaging the general's army was a rash and foolish move.
I am not pleased.
I applaud your initiative, Hurdenn. You've struck a great blow to our enemy.
Good work.
My hunt for the War Trust is complex. In the future, please clear such actions with me, first.
This is a delicate matter.
Now withdraw and allow Lieutenant Pierce and his men to scour for General Durant's headquarters. Understood?
Yes, well, of course. I'll make it so immediately. My lord.
We'll get something on Durant. I swear it. Good luck with General Minst.
Lieutenant Pierce, I know where to find General Minst. I'm heading there now.
Great news. I've got some, too. Scout report. The battalion of War Trust General Durant is on the move.
Odds are he's fortifying his position.
Some of my black ops pals are back. We could have discreetly followed the battalion to find the general.
What do you mean "could have"?
I sense a "but" coming.
You're right.
No good, though.
Only I can authorize such an action, Lieutenant.
You will do no such thing.
Nothing to worry about. The opportunity is lost.
Moff Hurdenn sent a platoon instead, grounded me and the boys.
His forces are engaging Durant's as we speak. He's killing our chances.
Summon Hurdenn into this conversation. I'll address him.
Go get the Moff.
My lord.
Perhaps the situation can still be salvaged.
All is not lost.
Moff wants to update you on his plans.
He is your superior, Lieutenant. You are bordering on insubordination.
Remember your rank, soldier.
Noted. Hurdenn wants to update you himself. Here he is.
Transmitting the Republic caravan transponder frequencies now.
Give me a minute to retrace their routes, see where they converge.
While this is crunching, I just got a report of a small explosives depot in your area. I smell an opportunity.
You could grab explosives from the depot, plant them on the caravans. When Republic troops come to recover the caravans... boom.
We're not here for random chaos. Concentrate on the War Trust.
We're sticking with the plan.
Your call.
Any chance to hurt the Republic, we take it.
Good man.
My lord.
My mission has priority, but if the opportunity presents itself on the way, I'll consider it.
We'll see.
Thought I'd mention it.
Triangulation's complete. Only one place these caravans could be going. Transmitting coordinates....
Has to be General Frellka's location.
Perhaps.
What else is over there?
We beat the Reps out of there a few months back; all we found were rank caves that pirates used to use.
If they snuck back in, they're after something.
I appreciate it.
My lord.
Good hunting.
Heard we're going after the War Trust. Did some homework. If that is the mission, I'm fully prepped.
Our targets are indeed the high generals of the Republic Strategic High Command.
You've heard correctly.
Time well spent, then.
Direct and active. We'll get along just fine.
Well done, soldier.
My lord.
I like a man who goes after what he wants.
[Flirt] Well done, soldier.
I'm steady and sure in all situations, my lord.
What do we know so far?
All four of the War Trust generals are here on Taris, which means something big. But they never show their faces.
Got my hands on a Republic scout, leaned on him. Hard. He was setting up supply routes for General Frellka, the War Trust's junior member.
I'd like to interrogate this scout personally.
Show me to the prisoner.
He's dead. Sorry.
Next time, leave interrogation to the professionals.
That's very disappointing.
People don't just die from exhaustion.
You mean you killed him.
I overestimated his stamina. Said I was sorry.
It's inconsequential. A lead is a lead.
No matter.
You're already proving to be a valuable asset.
Good work.
The story checked out.
Now that you're under my command, such tactics will not be tolerated.
I don't condone torture.
Noted.
Been scoping the area the scout described. Several heavily armed Republic supply caravans run along carefully staggered routes.
Couple dozen soldiers could hit the caravans, pull their transponders, triangulate their destination with the equipment here. Moff Hurdenn can't spare the manpower, though.
I'm easily the match of a couple dozen foot soldiers.
I'll take the caravans out.
Then I guess I'm running the tech.
I know you're a field soldier, but I'll need you to do the triangulation.
Can you handle the equipment?
Not really my thing, but I'm trained. Leaves you to take on those caravans.
I wouldn't trust Hurdenn to tie my boots.
The Moff is useless anyway.
Then it's up to us. You hit those caravans, I'll play tech monkey.
Here are the coordinates. Caravans run daily, but they vary the timing. I'm sure you'll come upon them eventually.
Hit enough and snag the transponders. I'll figure out where they're going. Should zero in on General Frellka.
Moff Hurdenn, the Sith is here.
What's that, Lieutenant? Oh, I didn't see you come in. You must be the Sith Darth Baras sent. Welcome to Taris.
Indeed. My mission is of high importance. Brief me on the situation here.
What information do you have?
Yes, right, as I told Darth Baras, I have long sought an opportunity to assist him and am eager to contribute however I am able.
Well met.
Try to pay attention to your surroundings. Had I been an enemy, you'd be dead.
You're not very observant.
I have high confidence that my command center is well garrisoned. But I heed your point.
I have never had cause to assist Darth Baras before, but I have long been an admirer of his work, and yours, of course.
I doubt she came all this way to be fawned on.
I doubt he came all this way to be fawned on.
Of course. May I introduce Lieutenant Pierce, on loan from one of our notorious black ops divisions. He is hands down my finest officer.
I give you exclusive reign of him while you're on Taris, which I trust will accommodate your every need.
Lieutenant, your service to me begins immediately.
Then let's waste no time.
Good.
Pierce, are you ready to accommodate me? It can be very rewarding.
[Flirt] Hello, Lieutenant.
Rewarding is good.
Yes, well, I will leave the two of you to your mission, then.
I hope he is up to the task.
He'd better.
Pierce represents the elite of the Empire's elite. And then some.
As you proceed, if I can offer any further aid, do not hesitate to contact me.
All my needs met by a single trooper? Your assistance is underwhelming, Hurdenn.
One soldier?
Pierce is beyond capable, and--my troops are stretched thin, but I'll try to make more available to you soon.
I will get right on that, and let you get acquainted.
